commander.name: Major-General Francis Tuker
commander.previous_service: Assumed command December 1941, led division through Gazala and El Alamein battles

command.headquarters_location: El Alamein sector, Egypt - Center of Allied front, Ruweisat Ridge

supply_logistics.supply_status: GOOD - Integrated into 8th Army supply system. Division in static defensive position at Ruweisat Ridge allows good stockpiling. Diversionary role reduces ammunition consumption vs assault divisions. Supply from Alexandria via coastal road.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Western Desert - Center of El Alamein front, Ruweisat Ridge. Relatively firm ground with low ridges and escarpments.

subordinate_units.note: Veteran brigade - East Africa, Western Desert campaigns
Returned from Cyprus October 1942, reunited with division for El Alamein
Temporarily attached to replace lost 11th Brigade (until December 1942)

tactical_doctrine.role: Infantry division holding center of Allied front at Ruweisat Ridge as diversionary force for Second Battle of El Alamein. Mission: Fix Axis forces in place with 'stiff fighting' while main breakthrough occurs in northern sector.
special_capabilities: Veteran division with continuous desert warfare experience since 1940
Strong brigade cohesion despite dispersal earlier in 1942
Indian Army mountain warfare expertise adapted to desert
tactical_innovations: Defensive positions on Ruweisat Ridge maximized use of terrain
Diversionary attacks coordinated with main assault timing
Integration of 161st Brigade smoothly executed despite short notice
known_issues: Brigades had been dispersed to other formations until October 1942
Limited time for reunited division to train together before El Alamein
161st Brigade attachment temporary - different training/equipment standards
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Fully adapted for desert warfare - veteran of multiple desert campaigns (Compass 1940-41, East Africa 1941, Crusader 1941, Gazala 1942). Extensive experience with water discipline, desert navigation, vehicle maintenance in harsh conditions.

scenario_suitability: Second Battle of El Alamein (23 October - 11 November 1942) - Ruweisat Ridge defensive/diversionary operations
Indian Army in Western Desert scenarios
special_rules: Desert warfare veteran bonus (+2 in desert terrain)
Diversionary tactics (enemy cannot determine main effort)
Indian Army mountain infantry training (applicable to ridge warfare)
historical_engagements: East Africa Campaign (1941) - Keren, Amba Alagi
Second Battle of El Alamein (23 Oct - 11 Nov 1942) - Ruweisat Ridge
